reviews.review_msg: Encourages creativity

The class is okay, not hard material or anything. 
He is knowledgeable of his material but he is so full of himself, he gives Troy Bolton's dad vibe, idk, I have mixed feelings with his cocky attitude. 
The TA was terrible, what we covered in tutorials vs. in-class had nothing to do with each other. Lame project.

Peter is such a great prof, you can tell hes really passionate about his work. His concepts are easy to understand and what he expects from you is really clear. I would definitely take another class with him if I had the chance!

Peter was a decent prof. Good lecturer, but sometimes I felt like he talked more than he needed to (perhaps to fill the time), and so a lot of what I was listening to in the lecture was just supplementary to the readings. The readings are key in this course. Not many assignments which was nice, and overall he's a cool guy.
Peter was awesome! Extremely engaging in lectures, which helps because a lot of the important information is only learnt through lecture.

Towards the end, the only reason I dragged myself to lectures was because I rationalized that some youth my age didn't have the right or opportunity to an education. I really don't think any university attending student with high marks should feel this way about attending lecture, especially if they want to learn.

Cool prof. He's very clear in his statements during lecture which is what a great prof should have. Concepts are relatively easy to grasp. Overall, this is one of the more interesting cmns courses if you're interested in the new media, the Internet, etc.

He genuinely cares about his students and has never made a student feel dumb about asking a question. He is always encouraging and open minded. It was very refreshing taking a class with him! And his TA Becky is wonderful. She's a hard marker, but a perfect TA. Overall, great class.
A brilliant professor who teaches a course that is mind opening.

I've taken 353 and 345 with Roman and I will take as many classes with him as I can. I admit, he's not the greatest organizer, and sometimes I don't understand how the readings relate to the course, but he just has such an incredible mind it is an honour and a pleasure to take a class with him.

I had Roman for 110 also and really enjoyed him.  Midterms are very fair, he gives you the questions in advance and you just have to study them.  He's a really smart guy so sometimes somethings he says flies over my head, but I still enjoy his lectures.  My 110 TA kinda sucked, wasn't too helpful, but my 353 TA Daryl has been awesome so far.
one of the best profs i've ever had, if not the absolute best.

go to class, do the important readings, and you will EASILY ace this course. Anyone complaining about her is just bitter that they didn't do well (probably because they didn't pay attention). Got an A+ and barely tried. Maggie was super helpful and provided very useful feedback. The content she prepared was interesting and relevant.
Both exams are intensely based on readings which prof rarely covers in lectures. tutorials help more, would suggest just going to tuts and not lectures

For a 300 level course, the course is very beginner. Should be a 100 level course, and honestly that makes it more difficult because she goes over completely different topics each week, so the broadness makes it harder. Exams also are multiple choice heavy which honestly is confusing to me and peers in the class. Nice lady, poor instructor.

Maggie spends a lot of time asking questions in lecture before teaching, and wastes time waiting on students' answers when we have yet to begin week's topic. Lectures are slow, off-topic, unprofessional, and not to par with a 300x level CMNS course. She appears as a nice person, but is a poor instructor. Treats 3 hour lectures like seminars.

The most helpful prof ever! After my tutorial, Maggie actually runs out of time for her office hour, but she still gives me feedback with patience. If you have any concern for the assignment, just talk to her! She will help you all the way she can!

Loved Maggie. Good public speaker, engaging, and really interesting/relatable content! Midterms were fair if you studied. Assignments were actually fun! I'm going to try and get her as a prof in the future for sure. Defs recommend her :)

Maggie is awesome! She is passionate about what she teaches & the assignments are really fun. I don't say this ever but I enjoyed the readings she assigned, they were very interesting. Midterms are fair.
Darryl is the best TA I have ever had. He knows more theory than any TA I've ever had and he is really nice and helpful. Plus he's really funny and adorable.
Awesome!!! Refreshing, funny, interesting. Favorite TA of all time.

This class was not enjoyable. The lack of communication was absolutely horrible and 90% of the time no one knew what was going on (including the TA) in the lectures, assignments, and the take-home final. He often would cancel class with very little notice and would not change the syllabus, would just cram everything into another class.

If he's marking your stuff GOOD LUCK. He is such a difficult marker. Was the definition of a white American privileged man. He made snarky comments and was super condescending. He'll lecture something and say "yeah whatever" when he doesn't wanna explain. Assignments were SO long yet worth nothing. Midterm and Final were difficult. DON'T RECOMMEND.

I thought Steve seemed very nice, but it's evident that he cares more about being well-liked than actually supporting students' learning. Gave out tons of free marks that reward students who haven't done any work, and he's very dismissive outside of lecture. He's the epitome of a "chill" teacher who doesn't care about what you get out of the class.

It was refreshing taking a class with a teacher that wants to provide students with skills that are transferable for after school, not just in prep for a masters. His lectures were informative and pushed to get students to think critically about the material. It's obvious he has a passion for the subject matter. Always available for extra help.

Steven Malcic is one of the best professors I have ever had! His lectures are so relevant and interesting, he provides excellent feedback and his very quick to respond to emails, and genuinely wants his students to do well. I was pleasantly surprised to receive 100% on the take home final.

Steve was one of the best profs I've had throughout my 5 years at SFU. He genuinely cares about his students and is always willing to help. He made the 3-hour lectures entertaining and informative. He's funny and relatable. I look forward to having more classes with him.

Steven is without a doubt the best professor I've had across multiple schools in my 3+ years of university. I've never had a prof make himself so available to talk about anything and everything. He's a passionate, hilarious dude and I always looked forward to his lectures despite it being three hours and my last of three lectures on a Thursday.

greatest cmns professor i've ever had at SFU. i've taken a course with him before and i thoroughly enjoy his lecturing style and his passion for what he teaches. super accessible outside class, very reasonable amount of homework and you will come out of the class engaged

I've taken 253, and 353 w/ her and will be taking two more in upcoming semester. She's my favourite prof because she's entertaining, engaging and cares about her students. She's so smart and always willing to go above to help students excel in their learning. She's a great human genuinely and has made a difference in my attitude towards school! :)

Stephanie is a wonderful and very passionate professor! Very approachable as well. If you simply do the readings and attend lectures and tutorials, the course is very manageable. There are not many assignments, and the content is relevant to current global issues. To get high marks, however, you need to bring something new to the table.

Stephanie is one of the most sweetest and caring profs I have had. Her lectures were always super interesting and made it engaging. The content is not overly difficult as long as you put in some effort. She truly wants to see her students succeed.

Stephanie is probably my new favourite professor. She was super fantastic at lecturing and was incredibly passionate about her work and the topic at hand. She was always happy to talk about the lecture and was happy to answer questions. I'm sad that I'm graduating and I'm not able to take more of her classes.
